issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
_HOST is not properly substituted when we use VIP address. Currently it always used the host name of the machine and disregard the VIP address. It is true mainly for RM, NM, WebProxy, and JHS rpc service. Looks like it is working fine for webservice authentication.

On the other hand, the same thing is working fine for NN and SNN in RPC as well as webservice.
fields.summary: _HOST doesn't expand properly for RM, NM, ProxyServer and JHS

This message is automatically generated.

No new functionality was introduced. Fixed a bug that was implemented in other cases.
But I tested it in a cluster environment.

Secondly,  I ran the failed test case (mvn test -Dtest=TestRMWebServicesApps -Pnative) and it ran fine for me. Looks like it was some timing issue.

Tx for the bug-report and the patch Mohammad! Couple of questions:

bq. It is true mainly for RM, NM, WebProxy, and JHS rpc service. Looks like it is working fine for webservice authentication.
I didn't understand what you meant by it is working for webservice? Which webservices? RM? And you meant SPNEGO auth?

I've checked HDFS and we aren't doing it for DataNodes. I can see why - usually you won't setup VIP for the slaves. Is that correct? If so, shall we also follow the same here for NodeManagers?

Before YARN-1505, we (mistakenly) had localhost:9099 as the address for the proxy-server. Being a central service, it makes sense for the web-app proxy to have a named port, so set the default to 9099?
New patch that addressed Vinod's comments.

bq. It is true mainly for RM, NM,, WebProxy, and JHS rpc service. Looks like it is working fine for webservice authentication.

It means RM UI (for example) works fine with _HOST. 
However, any RM rpc communication with NM (e.g.) doesn't work.

We tested that this patch resolved the RM<-->NM communications failure.
